data.title: Games Beaten 2022 - Forum
data.meta_description: Discuss the latest and greatest games with the HowLongToBeat community.
data.text:
3 Yr s✓#

I ended up beating A LOT more games this year than I ever did(though it consists of a good amount of replays and DLC's, too)

Now, time to go through each game. Times are for Main+Extras unless stated otherwise.

•January

10th - Superliminal (PC, 2019) - 9/10 - 3h 25m

16th - Need for Speed: Underground (PC, 2003) - 7/10 - 15h (est.)

23rd - Need for Speed: Underground 2 (PC, 2004) - 8/10 - 45h (est.)

•February

14th - Portal (PS3, 2007) - Replay - 2h 30m (est.) - I was literally just bored and figured to try out the PS3 version of the game. 2 hours later I find myself beating it. Again. Sigh.

•March

18th - Data Wing (Mobile, 2017) - Completionist - Replay - 1h 25m (est.)

29th - Duet (Mobile, 2015) - 8/10

30th - The Last of Us (PS3, 2013) - Main Story - 10/10 - 13h 44m

•May

9th - The Last of Us: Left Behind (DLC) (PS3, 2014) - Main Story - 8/10 - 1h 52m

9th - Sonic Unleashed (PS3, 2008) - 9/10 - 15h (est.) - After having the game on playing for like, a year or even two, I finally got back to it and beaten it when I couldn't play on the PC

13th - Sonic Colors (Wii version emulated on PC, 2010) - Main Story - 7/10 - 5h 51m

16th - Sonic Heroes (PC, 2004) - 7/10 - 14h 59m

21st - Celeste (Switch version emulated on mobile, 2018) - Replay - I was just messing with the Skyline emulator and figured to throw myself a challenge and beat the main story of Celeste on a phone

22nd - Sonic the Hedgehog (Xbox 360 version emulated on PC, 2006) - 8/10(for modded experience) - 17h 30m

24th - Shadow the Hedgehog (Gamecube version emulated on PC, 2005) - Main Story - 6/10 - 1h 30m

27th - Sonic Generations (PC, 2011) - Replay - 11h 50m

29th - Sonic Lost World (PC, 2013) - 8/10(for modded experience) - 7h

30th - Sonic Forces (PC, 2017) - Replay - 6h 40m

30th - Sonic Forces - Episode Shadow (DLC) (PC, 2017) - 6/10 - 50m

•June

9th - Cyberpunk 2077 (PC, 2020) - Completionist - 9/10 - 72h 30m

19th - The Walking Dead: The Telltale Definitive Series (PC, 2019 collection-remaster of 2012-2018 games) - Replay - 8/10 - 90h (est.)

23rd - Need for Speed: ProStreet (PC, 2007) - Completionist - 7/10 - 13h 7m

27th - Need for Speed: Undercover (PC, 2008) - 6/10 - 11h 3m

29th - Need for Speed: The Run (PC, 2011) - Replay - 8/10 - 11h 36m

•July

5th - Vector (Mobile, 2013) - Completionist - 8/10 - 8h 15m

10th - Hollow Knight (PC, 2017) - Completionist - 10/10 - 52h 23m

20th - S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl (PC, 2007) - Main Story - 7/10 - 20h

•August

1st - S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Clear Sky (PC, 2008) - 7/10 - 23h 30m

5th - S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Call of Pripyat (PC, 2010) - 8/10 - 25h

7th - Metro 2033 Redux (PC, 2014 remake of 2010 game) - 9/10 - 12h 20m

12th - Metro: Last Light Redux (PC, 2014 remaster of 2013 game) - 9/10 - 24h

17th - Metro Exodus (PC, 2019) - 9/10 - 32h 30m

20th - Metro Exodus: The Two Colonels (DLC) (PC, 2019) - 8/10 - 1h 50m

21st - Metro Exodus: Sam's Story (DLC) (PC, 2020) - 9/10 - 8h

28th - Marvel's Spider-Man Remastered (PC, 2022 port of a 2020 remaster of a 2018 game) - Completionist - 8/10 - 27h

29th - Marvel's Spider-Man: The Heist (DLC) (PC, 2022 port of a 2020 remaster of a 2018 dlc) - 8/10 - 3h

29th - Marvel's Spider-Man: Turf Wars (DLC) (PC, 2022 port of a 2020 remaster of a 2018 dlc) - Main Story - 7/10 - 2h

29th - Marvel's Spider-Man: Silver Lining (DLC) (PC, 2022 port of a 2020 remaster of a 2018 dlc) - 8/10 - 2h 20m

31st - Undertale (PC, 2015) - Replay - Co-Op mod - Neutral - 5h 38m

•September

2nd - Undertale (PC, 2015) - Replay - Co-Op mod - True Pacifist - 4h 55m

8th - Undertale (PC, 2015) - Replay - Co-Op mod - Genocide - 5h

14th - Ori and the Will of the Wisps (PC, 2020) - Completionist - Replay - 16h 17m

17th - Saints Row (Xbox 360 version emulated on PC, 2006) - 7/10 - 16h 25m

20th - Ori and the Will of the Wisps (PC, 2020) - Replay - 3h 24m

30th - Minecraft (PC, 2011) - Replay - 75h

•October

18th - Uncharted: Drake's Fortune (PS3, 2007) - 6/10 - 7h 50m

19th - A Way Out (PC, 2018) - Replay - 7h

23rd - Call of Duty: Modern Warfare II (PC, 2022) - 7/10 - 12h

26th - A Plague Tale: Requiem (PC, 2022) - 9/10 - 23h (est.)

•November

15th - Persona 5 Royal (PC, 2022 port-remaster of a 2019(2020 for worldwide release) expanded version of a 2016(2017 for worldwide release) game) - 10/10 - 100h 59m

25th - Persona 5 Strikers (PC, 2021) - 9/10 - 39h 35m

•December

1st - Sonic Frontiers (PC, 2022) - Completionist - 8/10 - 26h 40m

4th - Saints Row 2 (PC, 2008) - 8/10(for modded experience) - 14h 52m

6th - Vector 2 (Mobile, 2016) - 5/10(incomplete game) - 7h 28m

13th - Saints Row: The Third (PC, 2011) - Completionist - Replay - 9/10 - 21h 22m

14th - Saints Row: The Third - Genkibowl VII (DLC) (PC, 2012) - 7/10 - 42m

14th - Saints Row: The Third - The Trouble with Clones (DLC) (PC, 2012) - 7/10 - 42m

14th - Saints Row: The Third - Gangstas in Space (DLC) (PC, 2012) - 7/10 - 45m

16th - Saints Row: The Third Remastered (PC, 2021) - Replay - 6/10 - 7h 34m

23rd - Shadow Fight 2 - Special Edition (Mobile, 2017 backport of the switch version of a 2014 game) - 8/10 - 26h 20m

24th - Saints Row IV (PC, 2013) - Completionist - Replay - 15h 54m

24th - Saints Row IV - Enter the Dominatrix (DLC) (PC, 2013) - 8/10 - 48m

24th - Saints Row IV - How the Saints Save Christmas (DLC) (PC, 2013) - 8/10 - 1h 24m

25th - Saints Row: Gat out of Hell (Standalone DLC) (PC, 2015) - 7/10 - 4h 47m

•Retired

Saints Row (PC, 2022) - 5/10 - 12h (est.)

•Endless/Multiplayers played this year

Genshin Impact (PC, 2022)

Brawl Stars (Mobile, 2018)

Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six Siege (PC, 2015)

Fortnite (PC, 2017)

Forza Horizon 5 (PC, 2021)

A Hat in Time (PC, 2017)

Fall Guys (PC, 2020)

Roblox (PC, 2006)

Ultimate Chicken Horse (PC, 2016)

Trove (PC, 2015)

The Crew 2 (PC, 2018)

Sea of Thieves (PC, 2018)

Halo Infinite (PC, 2021)

Rocket League (PC, 2015)

Rocket League Sideswipe (Mobile, 2021)

Geometry Dash (PC&Mobile, 2013)

Transformice (PC, 2015)

Move or Die (PC, 2016)

Deep Rock Galactic (PC, 2018)

Slime Rancher (PC, 2016)

•Singleplayers I played, but left for later

The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild (Wii U version emulated on PC, 2017)

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt (PC, 2015)

Stardew Valley (Mobile, 2016)

Spyro Reignited Trilogy (PC, 2018)

Sonic the Hedgehog (1991)

Assassin's Creed (PC, 2007)

Tomb Raider (PC, 1996)

Red Dead Redemption 2 (PC, 2018)

The extremely long release dates are satire, of course. I've enjoyed this year overall, though it could've been nicer if not for russia. Oh well.

4 Yr s✓#

I beat 36 games this year which is a new record at least since I started tracking on this site and is a large increase from last year. Halfway through the year, I started being more critical of my completions because I had been giving too many games 9/10 ratings. Here's some interesting stats from this year's completions.

The longest game I beat was Teardown with 104 h 54 m, although a lot of that came from last year when I did part 1 of the game.

The shortest game I beat was What Remains of Edith Finch with 2 h 48 m.

I 100% 16 games, got Main+ on 14 and only got Main on 6 games.

I gave 3 games 10/10, 13 9/10, 7 8/10, 4 7/10, 3 6/10, 4 5/10, 1 4/10 and lastly 1 game got 3/10.

January 5th - Professor Layton and the Pandora's Box - 31 h 44 m - (100%) 8/10 - Beat the game, completed all 153 puzzles and got all of the bonuses.

January 14th - Bridge Constructor: The Walking Dead - 16 h 48 m - (100%) 8/10 - Beat all the levels underbudget and killed all 499 enemies.

January 29th - Undertale - 26 h 54 m - (100%) 10/10 - Beat all three routes. Didn't go for soulless endings or all hidden content.

February 4th - Her Story - 7 h 30 m - (100%) 8/10 - Saw all of the clips and got all of the achievements

February 11th - Teardown - 104 h 54 m - (Main+) 10/10 - Got all of the objectives in both parts of the main campaign, got 5 stars on all the Fetch levels as well.

March 10th - Superliminal - 5 h 24 m - (Main+) 9/10 - Beat the game and got some of the collectibles

March 10th - What Remains of Edith Finch - 2 h 48 m - (100%) 9/10 - Beat the game and got all of the achievements

April 3rd - Patrick's Parabox - 13 h 6 m - (Main+) 9/10 - Beat all levels in the main game. Only beat a few levels in the Reception area.

April 22nd - The Great Ace Attorney Chronicles - 80 h 44 m - (100%) 10/10 - Beat the game and got all of the accolades.

May 6th - The Stanley Parable: Ultra Deluxe - 8 h (100%) 9/10 - Got all of the endings and all but two achievements.

May 12th - Papers, Please - 19 h 12 m - (100%) 8/10 - Got all 20 endings and got all of the achievements.

June 7th - Fly Corp - 35 h 18 m - (Main+) 7/10 - Beat all challenges and got 86 out of 174 countries in the all-countries mode.

June 8th - Katamari Damacy Reroll - 6 h 30 m - (Main+) 9/10 - Beat all of the levels and got 85% of the collectables.

June 16th - Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair - 62 h 36 m - (Main+) 9/10 - Beat the game, got all Island endings, beat the Magical Girl Monomi mode and read the novel. Got 41/47 achievements.

June 23rd - Mario + Rabbids Kingdom Battle - 75 h - (100%) 9/10 - 100% the main game and the Donkey Kong Adventure DLC. Also did some multiplayer content.

July 8th - Cuphead: The Delicious Last Course - 17 h - (100%) 9/10 - Beat all the bosses and got all of the DLC achievements.

July 20th - Reigns Kings & Queens - 8 h 10 m - (Main) 5/10 - Got the true ending for the queen mode, but not for kings.

July 24th - Mario & Luigi: Paper Jam - 76 h 40 m - (100%) 7/10 - Got all of the collectibles and S ranked everything in the battle arena.

August 3rd - BOXBOY! - 6 h 3 m - (Main) 5/10 - Beat the game and got all the crowns in the main worlds.

August 4th - Celeste - 42 h - 32 m - (Main+) 9/10 - Beat all of the levels in A and B sides and half the C-sides. Also got all of the collectibles.

August 15th - Attack of the Friday Monsters! A Tokyo Tale - 3 h 27 m - (Main+) 5/10 - Beat the game and completed a few optional episodes.

September 27th - Will You Snail? - 17 h 48 m - (Main+) 8/10 - Beat the game and got all the springboards, exploration points and got 3/4 of all difficulty points. Visited every level

September 29th - Pushmo - 12 h 58 m - (Main) 6/10 - Beat every level in the main game. Not including any bonus levels

September 30th - Untitled Goose Game - 5 h - (Main+) 7/10 - Beat the game and got all of the normal and bonus objectives and two of the timed ones.

October 12th - Danganronpa V3: Killing Harmony - 77 h 5 m 25 s - (Main+) 9/10 - Beat the game, reached max bond with everyone, beat the first boss in monokuma's test and got 80% of the achievements.

October 14th - I Expect You To Die 2 - 10 h 10 m - (100%) 9/10 - Beat the game and got all of the souvenirs.

October 15th - Airport Madness 3D - 62 h 18 m - (100%) 6/10 - Got every achievement.

October 25th - Super Mario Bros - 5 h 35 m - (Main) 3/10 - Beat the game. Used save states.

October 28th - Professor Layton and the Lost Future - 32 h 4 m - (100%) 9/10 - Beat all 168 puzzles.

October 30th - Snipperclips Plus - 11 h 49 m - (Main+) 6/10 - Beat all levels in the one-two player campaign and did a chunk of levels from two-four player campaign.

November 1st - The Case of the Golden Idol - 7 h 42 m - (100%) 9/10 - Beat the game and filled in all of the mysteries in all of the cases.

November 15th - Donkey Kong Country - 7 h 40 m - (Main) 5/10 - Beat the game. Used save states.

November 20th - Super Mario Bros. 3 - 14 h 28 m - (Main) 4/10 - Beat the game. Used save states.

December 13th - Clone Drone in the Danger Zone - 41 h 6 m - (100%) 8/10 - Got all 57 achievements except the doborog one.

December 24th - Luigi's Mansion: Dark Moon - 19 h 10 m - (Main+) 7/10 - Got all gems, boos and did all the bonus missions.

December 25th - Octopath Traveler - 63 h 9 m - (Main+) 8/10 - Did four chapters for four characters, got the main 8 jobs and did a good chunk of the side quests.

4 Yr s♥✓#

6 Yr s♥$✓#

26 Games in Total (1 missing from the photo since I beat Chop Goblins a couple days ago). A better year slightly than 2021, but overall the quality of the games I played were very mixed, some good, some amazing, some not that great, one pretty not good.

JANUARY:

Serious Sam: The Second Encounter HD (Replay, PC, 01/14, 9/10)

Star Trek: Voyager - Elite Force (PC, 01/21, 6/10)

The Spy Who Shot Me (PC, 01/23, 8/10)

FEBRUARY:

Serious Sam: Siberian Mayhem (PC, 02/04, 10/10) - Top 5 of 2022

Half-Life 2: Lost Coast (Replay, PC, 02/23, 7/10)

MARCH:

Half-Life (Replay, PC, 03/04, 9/10)

Kirby Star Allies (Replay, Switch, 03/16, 8/10)

Chex Quest HD (PC, 03/20, 5/10) - Worst Game of 2022

Brave: The Search for Spirit Dancer (PS2, 03/27, 8/10)

APRIL:

Serious Sam 3: BFE (Replay, PS5, 04/18, 8/10)

Serious Sam 3: Jewel of the Nile (Replay, PS5, 04/26, 7/10)

MAY:

Turbo Overkill -Episode 1 Early Access- (PC, 05/04, 6/10) - Biggest Disappointment

Prey -2006- (Xbox One X, 05/25, 9/10) - Top 5 of 2022 and Last Game on Xbox One X

JUNE:

Rage - The Scorchers DLC (Replay, PC, 06/04, 7/10)

Rage - Base Game (Replay, PC, 06/27, 6/10)

JULY:

Call of Duty (PC, 07/28, 6/10)

AUGUST:

Forza Horizon 5 (Xbox Series X, 08/11, 8/10)

SEPTEMBER:

Half-Life: Restored (PC, 09/06, 9/10) - Top 5 of 2022

Soldier of Fortune (PC, 09/24, 6/10)

OCTOBER:

Prodeus -Full Release- (PC, 10/25, 9/10) - Top 5 of 2022

Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2019 (PS5, 10/26, 8/10) - Best Story

Sniper Elite V2 Remastered (Replay, PS5, 10/27, 7/10)

NOVEMBER:

Requiem of Science -Half-Life 2 Mod- (PC, 11/21, 7/10)

Chasm: The Rift (PC, 11/27, 7/10)

DECEMBER:

Singularity (PC, 12/07, 8/10)

Chop Goblins (PC, 12/29, 10/10) My GOTY and Top 5 of 2022

By far my favorite game of the year was the last one I played, Chop Goblins. David Szymanski continues to be a master of FPS Games by creating a short, but extremely satisfying and funny FPS that showcases why Boomer Shooters are a thing (it's because of him). Other noteworthy games include Serious Sam: Siberian Mayhem (Because of course I loved a Serious Sam game), Singularity (which had a fantastic story and setting), Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2019 (a game that was super rewarding and satisfying as a fan of the franchise and overall was just really well made) and of course, Prey 2006 which despite having one of the most unlikeable and selfish main characters in FPS History is one of the most original and unique and groundbreaking games I have played from that time. LIKE WOW.

Some of the lesser games were disappointing especially since I thought I would love them. The original Call of Duty is extremely redundant and falls apart during the latter half, Turbo Overkill is hugely overpraised with it's first episode being overly difficult because why not and just feels frustrating despite some great things going on in it, so hopefully the devs will be able to balance things more and make it better when it gets to full release. Star Trek: Voyager - Elite Force has a great story and characters, but overall I found the FPS Formula did no favors for the gameplay. And Chex Quest HD? Yeah, it was bad, not gonna lie. I heard it's a downgrade from the original WAD so I'll have to check that out, but it has the most pitiful AI imaginable, is so easy calling it a cakewalk is an insult to cakes and overall it's Jank Low Budget Unreal Engine 4 look does it no favors at all. The nice thing is that there are multiple characters to play as with unique lines of dialogue, so if you REALLY do care to play through all characters it's a nice change of pace.

As for replays, there were quite a few. I spent a lot of time on Rage which has not aged as well as I thought. I gave more current opinions on Serious Sam 3 and it's expansion Jewel of the Nile, replayed Half-Life again before going through the excellent Half-Life: Restored mod which is my favorite way to play the game now and Kirby Star Allies helped me get through a very dark time in my life this year.

2022 has not been a great year for me overall in terms of what happened in my life despite some good things happening. I've been through tons of depression spouts and overall I just wasn't happy for most of the year. But I will say that 2023 is looking much brighter. Next year I'm planning to play more ambitious games. I'm going to finish Kingdoms of Amalur: Re-Reckoning, Yakuza Kiwami and a couple other games I haven't finished while going through more bigger games like Ghost of Tsushima, Blue Dragon, Immortals Fenyx Rising and overall just trying some newer experiences that are out of my comfort zone. I will continue playing Boomer Shooters and FPS Games of course but my computer really needs to be upgraded starting with my Water Cooler that needs to be replaced and replacing my 2 TB Hard Drive with 2 1TB SSDS.

Happy New Year Everyone!
